summary: A telegram reports Manolo Ray's opposition to a Cuban invasion, asserting that internal resistance, supported by a broad base within Cuba, is the preferred method to overthrow Castro.
summary_one_paragraph: This October 1961 telegram reports that Manolo Ray, the exile leader of the People's Revolutionary Movement (MRP), expressed firm opposition to any invasion of Cuba, believing that Castro's removal should come from internal resistance, which he claimed was already underway. Ray stated that the MRP was well-organized and enjoyed widespread support, estimating that 80% of the Cuban population opposed Castro. Ray insisted that the MRP had more support than the original revolution had at its start.
title: Statements of Manolo Ray, Exile Leader of the People's Revolutionary Movement
